intro: Hieracium condensiforme, commonly known as the dense-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow, hairy, and arranged in a rosette pattern, while its flowers are yellow and clustered in dense inflorescences. Hieracium condensiforme is known for its ability to thrive in diverse environmental conditions, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
